result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Welter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA & follow up treatment as recommended.
AODA & follow up treatment as recommended.
Absolute sobreity from alcohol and drugs.

Must enroll in and complete SAFE program.
Other counseling deemed appropriate.
No objection to probation transfer to Langlade County.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R Welter

Case called:  2:14 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
Includes cases 14CF280, 14CF533, and 14CF1083. 
State appears by ADA Lesli Pluster. Defendant appears in person and with Atty John Bliss. 
Atty Pluster files an Amended Information in case 13CF863.
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI 14CF280 Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony), both counts in 14CF533, and 14CF1083 Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony) and Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony) .  
PLEA: 
13CF863>> NO CONTEST- Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property, Domestic Abuse), Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse), Ct. 3 (Resisting an Officer, Repeater), Ct. 4 (Misdemeanor BJ, Repeater).
14CF280>> NO CONTEST-Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony).
14CF1083>> NO CONTEST-Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony).
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
Victim D.W. reads Victim Impact Statement. 
Atty Bliss makes statement.
Defedant makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: With hold sentence. 3 years probation CONDITIONS: Must enroll and complete the SAFE Program or equivalent program, AODA and follow up treatment as reccommended, Absolute sobriety alcohol and drugs, other counseling deemed appropriate, Court Costs, and 2 DA Surcharges, DNA Surcharge on only the 14CF cases that charges are on. No Objection to probation transfer to Langlade County. 
Adjourned: 2:30 pm

Clerk Marisa.

Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
Parties to see Br. 5 JA to set future dates. 
Bond:  Continued

Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
